result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandra L. Mendoza

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sandra L Mendoza in court.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Sandra L Mendoza. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM521/22CM1066. Attorney Gardner advises the Court that the DE is scheduled for a plea and sentencing in her Racine case on December 12th. Both parties are requesting an adjournment after that date. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sandra L. Mendoza
Current: 8743 Sheridan Rd Lot 48, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 6009 31St Ave,3, Kenosha, WI 53142

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant, Sandra Mendoza, appeared in court in person.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM521/22CM1066. The State advises the Court that there is an offer, but was waiting to discuss it with the DE to see if she would like to retain an attorney. DE states that she applied at the SPD Office and is eligible for appointment. DE is waiting for an attorney to be appointed. Court adjourns. Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

221PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
and witness list filed by the State
